meanings.definition: Lacking in importance or worth; insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The paltriness of the old toy made it easy to overlook among the newer ones.
meanings.sent2: The paltriness of the gift was evident from the small, cheap wrapping paper.
meanings.sent3: The paltriness of the situation was so comical that it made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The paltriness of his excuse was like trying to cover a mountain with a tiny pebble.
meanings.sent5: The paltriness of the tiny seed held the potential for a mighty oak tree within.

meanings.definition: Meager or inadequate in amount or quality.
meanings.sent1: The paltriness of the meal left everyone still hungry after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The paltriness of the fabric made it tear easily with just a slight pull.
meanings.sent3: The paltriness of the attempt to fix the leak with tape only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The paltriness of his singing voice was like a whisper in a roaring storm.
meanings.sent5: The paltriness of the paint job revealed itself with every scratch and chip.
